result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with co actor Eric Robinson, Reynoldo G.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Restitution set at zero. Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation; convert balance into civil judgment. Upon revocation, to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

timeConds.notes: Good time to apply. No electronic monitoring.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant indicating that he received the credit on his sentence and that he is not entitled to credit on the condition time per caselaw.
Letter from defendant asking for "time credited".

Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 1:  Dismissed and read-in
Count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 months, with credit for 93 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 months the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 months.  This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 3 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of Probation and extended supervision:
-12 months in the House of Correction-good time to apply- No electronic monitoring.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with co actor Eric Robinson, Reynoldo G
-Seek and maintain full time employment
Restitution set at zero.
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--surcharge to be paid over probation; convert balance into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation; convert balance into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has not yet seen discovery from video.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 34.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-24-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING & BAIL REVIEW HEARING  (34 pages) commencing MAY 5, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Thomas J Flanagan in court, defendant Jeremiah Armstrong not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J Flanagan in court, defendant Jeremiah Armstrong not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING AND BAIL REVIEW commencing MAY5, 2014  received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1725  (34 Pages).

Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail argued.  Motion denied.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Matte-MPD Officer, Matthew Retzlaff-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Reynaldo G.; 3510 N 7th St., Milwaukee, WI; or co-defendant Eric Robinson.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Defendant Jeremiah Armstrong in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  As to Count 1:  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
